queue.tweet: US stocks wrapped a solid week (Sept 15–19, 2025): S&P 500 up about 1.0–1.2%, Nasdaq around 2%, Dow around 1%. Tech and consumer discretionary led; financials and energy lagged. Fed rate-cut expectations and strong earnings helped breadth; volatility cooled amid calmer sessions.
queue.summary:
Week snapshot: Major indices finished higher for the period, with the S&P 500 up roughly 1.0–1.2%, Nasdaq about 2%, and the Dow near 1%. 

Sector pulse: Tech and consumer discretionary led gains, while financials and energy underperformed.

Drivers and breadth: Fed rate-cut expectations and solid earnings news supported a broad advance; volatility eased after earlier jitters, with breadth remaining favorable.
